affirmation: I cultivate habits of excellence in all that I do.
My purpose is to actively exercise my soul's faculties in conformity with virtue.
I am a rational being, and I use my reason to guide my actions.
I find happiness in living a life of virtue and purpose.
I am by nature a social and political animal; I thrive in community.
I face life's challenges with courage, finding the mean between fear and recklessness.
I act with justice, fairness, and for the common advantage.
I am a lifelong learner, for all men by nature desire to know.
I nurture deep, virtuous friendships that are essential to a complete life.
I use my power of speech to persuade with truth, reason, and good character.
I seek the golden mean in my emotions and actions, avoiding excess and deficiency.
I contemplate the deeper reality and principles that govern the world.
I observe the natural world with wonder, knowing nature does nothing in vain.
I understand things by seeking their ultimate purpose and final cause.
My soul is the active essence of my being, guiding my growth and perception.
I use my wealth as a tool for virtuous living, not as an end in itself.
I appreciate art that represents the inward significance of things, not just their appearance.
I fulfill my role within my community with dignity and responsibility.
I develop my character through consistent, deliberate practice.
I bear the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
I am patient, for the roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
I am open to entertaining a thought without immediately accepting it.
I find joy in noble actions and take pleasure in doing what is right.
I build a life that is self-sufficient and allows for noble actions.
I act with practical wisdom, discerning the right course in each situation.
My mind is capable of grasping the first principles of things.
I see the whole as more than the sum of its parts.
I am a part of the city, and I contribute to its good life.
I choose a life of action in accordance with virtue.
I understand that excellence is not an act, but a habit.
I am the unifying principle of my thoughts and actions.
I seek the truth, for though we love our friends, we must honor the truth first.
I use my time wisely, for it is the number of motion in respect of before and after.
I am a valuable member of the middle class, bringing stability to society.
I deliberate well about what is good and advantageous for a flourishing life.
I express my complete virtue through my actions.
I am a good friend who wishes for the good of my friends for their own sake.
I am governed by reason, which is free from passion.
I find the energy of my mind to be the essence of my life.
I accept that one swallow does not make a spring; happiness requires a complete life.
I act with liberality, giving the right amounts to the right people at the right time.
I understand that the actual is prior to the potential.
I live in accordance with the law, which is reason embodied.
I cultivate the virtue of my soul through learning and contemplation.
I see the beauty in the order and symmetry of the world.
I am a citizen who knows how to both rule and be ruled.
I endure and fear the right things, for the right purpose, in the right way.
I recognize that the unexamined life is not worth living.
I am a link between the divine intellect and the physical world.
I find my place in the great chain of being.
I use rhetoric to highlight the truth, not to obscure it.
I am a substance, defined by my essential qualities and actions.
I cultivate the moral virtues that guide my interactions with others.
I understand that to perceive is to be acted upon, and I learn from my experiences.
I aim for the noble in all my actions and avoid the base.
I recognize that the state exists for the sake of the good life.
I am a being whose end is to actualize my potential.
I find friendship to be a slow-ripening fruit that I nurture with care.
I use my capacity for choice to steer my life toward eudaimonia.
I see the divine as the final cause that inspires all motion.
I am a political being who finds fulfillment in a just society.
I cultivate the intellectual virtues of wisdom, understanding, and art.
I understand that the worst form of inequality is to make unequal things equal.
I find confidence in the power of my own reasoned judgment.
I accept that poverty is the parent of revolution and crime, and I support a just economy.
I see the form in the matter, the purpose in the object.
I am a natural being, and I strive to understand my nature.
I act with equity, correcting the law when its generality fails in a particular case.
I find the metaphor to be a mark of genius in my thinking and communication.
I am a composite of body and soul, and I care for both.
I understand that the universe is a system of ordered parts.
I cultivate the virtue of magnanimity, claiming only the honors I deserve.
I find pleasure in the activity of my soul in accordance with virtue.
I am a free person who rules myself through reason.
I see the tragic hero in myself, learning from my errors and frailties.
I use my memory to persist in my perceptions and build upon my knowledge.
I am a teacher who leads others to understand first principles.
I find the plot of my life to be its soul, and I strive to make it noble and complete.
I act with temperance, enjoying pleasures as I ought.
I am a part of a household, the foundational unit of society.
I understand that the mind, in a way, becomes all things.
I cultivate a sense of wonder, for in all things of nature there is something marvelous.
I find my identity in my actions and my character.
I am a being whose function is to live in accordance with reason.
I use dialectic to discuss difficulties and prove reputable opinions.
I find the city to be prior to the individual, and I serve my community.
I act with good will towards others, which is the foundation of friendship.
I am a student of politics, the master science of the good.
I understand that the virtuous person is the measure and rule of what is fine.
I find the ultimate value of life in awareness and the power of contemplation.
I cultivate the virtue of wit, finding the mean in humor.
I am a rational soul, and my highest activity is contemplation.
I use my knowledge of causes to have scientific understanding of the world.
I find that the friend is another self.
I act with shame when it is appropriate, feeling pain at the prospect of disgrace.
I am a mortal being who strives to live in accordance with the divine element within me.
I understand that the end of law is not to abolish or restrain, but to preserve and enlarge freedom.
I find that the best way of life is the life of virtue supported by external goods.
I cultivate the virtue of truthfulness about myself.
I am on a lifelong journey to actualize my potential and achieve Eudaimonia.
